This dress, like others that I have reviewed looked a little long/big before I put it on because I purchased it one size up.  With these cheaper dresses I would rather them be too big because most of them are ok to throw in the dryer.  This one however actually ended up fitting perfectly.  The fabric is a thick jersey cotton and I would note that the black ruffle at the bottom is not a separate layer, rather it is all one layer and the black part flairs out.  I am writing reviews on a bunch of these cheap dresses from China after reading many buyers comments that they are dissapointed with the cheap quality and the thin material.  Some of these dresses are better than others.  This one is not overly thin... but as I have said in a bunch of these reviews, understand what you are getting.  These dresses are not highly structured pieces that will nip you in and shape you.  If you are not happy with your body shape and you have lumps and bumps that you want to cover, than these cheaper dresses are probably not a great idea.  However, many of them look pretty good if you put full slips or shapewear underneath.  The pictures are accurate for the most part, however they make the dresses appear to be very structured, which again, they are not.  The benifit to the thin, cheap dress is that it is not the end of the world if you don't like it and they are great for summer compared to your heavier weight structured pieces.  I really like this dress and will definitly be wearing it to work but again, I put slips and shapewear underneath it and understand that the dress will not create shape, it just lays on the shape I already have.  When I buy these cheaper dresses I usually add belts, cardigans, pantyhose, etc. which makes them pulled together and look a lot less cheap.  If you are looking for a very special occassion dress that is going to make you look amazing or help trouble spots, then these cheaper dresses from china are not good.  However, if you are happy with your body shape and just want to buy some fun pieces to add to your everyday wardrobe, then they are a great option.

Everything made now is for over weight Americans with the pear shape body.  I have the apple shape: over-size middle with skinny legs like I had in my 20's still.  Anything that fits my waist 'swims' on my legs & makes me look huge.  I'm so tired of the 'relaxed fit' in all women's pants sold today (except for the skinny jeans for young people.  I'm 61 yo & can't do that either).  But leggings with a long enough tunic look great on my old body.  I'm buying another of these even tho they aren't as long as I'd like. I use to have a major problem loosing sunglasses.  I would always buy a cheap pair for $10 because I knew I would loose them or break them.  I would go through around 10-12 pairs a year.  Then I decided to get a good pair of sunglasses, I was thinking Oakley's.  So I went to the store, to be honest I had never heard of Maui Jim before that day, and tried on all sorts of sunglasses.  I had the pair of Oakley's in front of me and was prepared to buy them.  Then I saw the Maui Jim Banyans.  I was intrigued, so I tried them on.  The store seemed to go dark and I knew I had something.  The Banyans are sleek and sexy and the protection from the sun is unparalleled.  I fish a lot and that was really what I wanted a good pair for.  I'm terrible with estimated depth in the water but I've think I've seen fish with these glasses on that had to be in 25 feet of water.  Now obviously that was clear water but I've never had such clarity looking down into the water in my life.  The glasses are so good that when I don't have them and I go outside, I immediately go back inside and get my glasses, that's how good they are.  Now lets talk warranty!  Maui Jim's warranty is totally legit and it will only cost you $10 for shipping and handling to get you glasses fixed.  Scratches and normal ware and tare are not covered, but if anything brakes on the frame they will replace it at no cost (except for S&H).  I have had 2 experiences dealing with Maui Jim's directly and they have been nothing short of amazing.  My glasses had snapped at the hinge of one of the arms right in the middle of the summer.  So it was important for me to have my glasses so I decided to glue the piece back together, which I would regret.  The fix held for a couple of months but it got to the point where I could no longer repair them myself.  So I went to Maui Jim's website, filled out a form, printed out my packing slip, boxed up my glasses, and my package was off in the mail.  I can't remember exactly how long it was that I sent my glasses to the time I heard back from them, but it wasn't long at all.  The had inspected my glasses and then called me to inform me of the situation.  So it turns out that because I tried to repair my glasses myself with super glue they were unable to get the screw out to repair my glasses.  To say the least I was devastated.  Then they went above and beyond for me to keep my a happy and loyal customer.  They offered me a discounted pair of glasses and out of respect for what they did for me I'm not going to say how much but lets just say I immediately said yes and had a new pair of glasses on my way.  Every single person that I dealt with at the company was amazing.  I am in sales myself at a very customer service oriented company so I take how a company treats me very seriously.  Out of all the companies I have ever dealt with Maui Jim's is right at the top.  I can only speak for the quality of the Banyan line of sunglasses but if that is any indication how the rest of the line is, BUY THEM.  I hope you found this helpful I know this may sound like a company PR review, but I assure you its not, I am 100% real and have no association with Maui Jim other than being a customer.  Oh and I totally suggest getting some sort of neck strap so you don't loose or drop your glasses!  I prefer the rope type but to each their own!!

If you're comfortable with clothes that cling to your skin, this would be worth the purchase, but if you prefer slightly looser clothing, I would consider other options.

reviewText: I really love this top, and it fits me perfectly - HOWEVER, the sizing of this (and every other crop top from iheartraves) is f*cked. I am 5'7 and 120 pounds, you'd think I wear a S/M, right? Wrong. Every time I buy a crop top from iheartsraves I have to buy a Large, unless you're skin and bones with no bust, or unless you like feeling like your shirt is crushing your lungs.. If you look at their sizing chart it even shows that all of the sizes have the same measurements, the only difference between S/M/L is the bust size. It's a wonderful shirt (one of my favorites now) and the materiel is a little stretchy, just be mindful of the size when ordering.

UPDATE 9/5/2015: Got exchange today. Watch is very good. Here are the points in its favor:

1) Inexpensive (easy to replace),
2) Reliable (will not fail on you unexpectedly; loses only 1 minute/month),
3) Simple (no extra plastic or writing that serves no purpose),
4) Well-constructed (steel, plastic, and golden coating),
5) Long service life (10-year battery I think which if the watch costs is $40 then you are paying $4/year to have consistent timekeeping).

The material is not that high quality but if anything spills on it its no problem since it wipes right off without staining.

BUT! I have a feeling its not going to last very long, as even the top handle broke off within the first week of having it (it was not even that full, and my husband grabbed it from that top handle and it broke straight off). It's not like its the cheapest priced bag out there so I kind of thought it would be more durable and last longer, but I guess not! But its still a decent bag, with good organization if you're not looking for something to keep for a long time.

This scarf is beautiful. It is closer to a shawl in terms of size - much wider than a scarf and slightly longer than typical scarves. The lightweight fabric is soft, so when it is bunched, it has some dimension. It is gauzy (see-thru), but the weave is stable and does not distort. The tassels are very nice on the corners, and the narrow hem is neatly stitched. The pattern features floral and organic shapes in the main panel, while the border depicts birds. Along the long edge is a wide band of narrow blue and white stripes. Along the short edge are elongated triangles with snowflake and floral motifs. The description mentioned a scent, but my scarf did not have one, thankfully! It is really beautiful and could easily double as a table runner. I bought it because it reminds me of a popular china pattern.
summary: Rich detail and smooth, flattering scarf!

Ok. So here's the thing.

As far as coloration goes, the hoodie looks about the same; but to call it a winter cardigan is someone's cruel idea of a joke. Don't get me wrong. It's really comfortable. Probably the nicest lounge jacket I've ever worn. It does not fit the body form-fitted however; and because no one really knows how small is too small with this jacket, its best to get it one size larger than you usually buy. Mine came 4x larger than expected. Go figure.

Its made from some strange polyester/nylon fabric. Its soft, but not like cotton, and there's no tag telling me otherwise.  The pocket came with a small hole, and there's also this stupid zipper on the shoulder, that's there purely for looks. Buuuut once its zipped up, it has the a-symmetrical zipper, and despite how thin it is, traps heat relatively well.

I'm hesitant to give this a purely awful rating, because while it wasn't what I expected, I was satisfied for what I paid for it. Its comfortable. If you're looking for a more aggressive assassin hoodie, this isn't gonna be your thing. If you're looking to be a cool kid and sit around playing video games; go for it.
summary: It's really comfortable. Probably the nicest lounge jacket I've ever worn

The quality is about the same as the reading glasses you can buy in dollar stores.  Lens is plastic and simply pushed into place within the front of the frame.  Accordingly be careful when wiping each lens clean.  It can pop out easily, but pushing it back into place is also easy.

The lens has no distortion and is effectively the same as using no glasses.  It is truly plano. The frame fits comfortably on the nose and ears.  The left/right balance is perfect.  I use it for driving on cloudy summer days to protect my eyes from wind and dust.

The glasses are shipped in a sturdy plastic case.  Considering they are mailed from Hong-Kong, it's nice to have the glasses so well protected.

Shirt quality is very good. Pleasantly surprised. I based my 4 star rating on the quality in appearance and feel after trying on.
Now about the size...
I am medium build 5',9" , 165-170lbs, broad shoulders. I read the reviews first and followed the recommendations to choose 2 sizes up to get the right fit. I.e For medium choose XL. Shirt arrived today and is way too big. Here are the measurements I took comparing them to medium shirts I own: (These measurements were taken by laying the shirt on a flat surface).

1. Arm Pit-to-Arm Pit: |  This XL shirt was 21.75 inches compared to a range of 19.5 to 20.5 inches for medium shirts I already own
2. Shoulder |  This XL shirt was 19.25 inches compared to a range of 17 to 18 inches for medium shirts I already own
3. Length Top-to-Bottom |  This XL shirt was 29 inches compared to a range of 27 to 27.5 inches for medium shirts I already own

I am returning and purchasing a medium. Willing to try another purchase because of the quality of the shirt in appearance and more importantly the feel of the fabric against the skin. The right size will really set it off!

Will provide a follow-up update when I receive it
summary: Quality Good, Going up 2 sizes as suggested turned out to be too big for me

So I was a little hesitant to buy this one, but the price was low enough to take a risk.

reviewText: Its like the picture but is made with low quality

I don't normally order many dresses for myself, and not ever do I buy dresses of this style. But I saw this dress and I thought the pattern was very cute, and with my Amazon Christmas giftcard I thought why not?

So I bought the dress. I got a medium, because I followed the size chart which is Chinese sizes so smaller than US sizing.
The dress itself was kind of awkward fitting. The sleeves being the weirdest part. It also fit me like a glove, and I had wanted a little more space.

I wore it out the night it arrived and the zipper broke, coming off its track. I did not want to pay to ship it back, waiting two months before getting a new one that could likely break just as easily.
The company agreed to pay me 30%. However, this dress was roughly $62 dollars. 30% of $62 would be nearly $19, and I was paid $11.
But after all the trouble, I didn't want to try and go further into trying to get something back.

All in all, it is a very nice, very cute dress. I really do love it, there's just a lot of problems I've experienced and the wait was extremely long.
Nice dress! Just be careful before you buy.

When we first received these shirts, we were very confused by the size on the tag.  We ordered a Medium and received an XXL.  Turns out the tag references Asian sizing, which is different from USA sizing.  When we actually opened the individually wrapped shirt and tried it on - it fit exactly as we expected.  Kudos to the kind customer service reps at the manufacturing company for patiently pointing this out and changing our initial disappointment to satisfaction.

These shirts are very soft and the slim fit looks fantastic.  The fabric is light-weight and perfect for spring wear or layering. The loop and button closure on the front is unique and appealing.  This is a great buy at the current sale price.  We highly recommend.
summary: Great Shirt - Don't be surprised by different size on label!

reviewText: You get what you pay for.  For the money, the quality is good, but I'm returning mine.  It's cheap looking.  I can't see myself in it.  It is warm however.

I love faux leopard coats and look for the ones where you can tell the textile designer actually spent some time and thought on rendering the spots beautifully. I wear these as housecoats in the cold early morning and late evening hours. After reading other reviews that it felt like a robe, I was convinced that this was the new housecoat for me, and ordered it. The fur is plush and soft, like a high quality stuffed animal toy. It is machine washable gentle, line dry, all polyester. I love the lavish shawl collar, which you can turn up and it stays there - keeping your neck and back of head warm. The hook/eye closures are tight and not easy to work with cold, old hands, but you could pry the hook open a little more to make it easier. I was wondering why the manufacturer/care labels were sewn inside the left pocket, until I found a removable hang tag under the arm that says "REVERSIBLE". I tried it, and it is, but I like the leopard side out better. I am 5' 100 lbs and the small fits fine. For the price, this is a good faux leopard coat to knock around in. The classic style is glamorous (important for a housecoat the cats and chickens will see!) and obviously fake, which makes it even more fun. I am enjoying it.

Cutest coat I've ever purchased for that price.  Granted, the quality isn't that of a high priced coat but looks much, much better than I expected.  I can see why someone said they use it as a robe around the house.  It's THAT light and comfortable.
Waiting for the cold. This coat is fun. It looks like a fake but that is the point!

This is a very fun coat, like it alot.  I am always a 2X or size 22 Plus, I have a broad back, and am of average height, not long arms.  I ordered a 2X which listed on size chart is 20 to 22 Plus.  It fit perfectly.  I have trouble with clothing binding and being tight in back because of my build, but this coat had plenty of room to stretch my arms out in front without binding.  The sleeve length is perfect.  If you have long arms they may be a bit short.  This coat is not fitted, so it is quite roomy in the abdomen area.  It fits like a stadium coat, so if you are large in the stomach area you will not have a problem with fit.  The collar is large and when you pull it up it will cover 3/4 of your head.  Closure is a fabric coated hook and eye.  Pockets are roomy.  No where on the coat is there a care label.  There is an attached tag that lists lining and outer material as 100% Polyester.  I am assuming it could be washed gently.  Made in China as is everything now days.  The lining is a nice light weight Poly, making it easy to get arms in and out.  OK, now I will come clean and admit I bought both patterns/colors, and like them both.  The white coat with black spots is just as nice, fits the same, but on my computer monitor the spots look blue but are actually gray, which I like better.  These coats are a nice weight and will keep me warm in most winter weather here in Michigan.

reviewText: Liked it
runs small

If you are shopping for a Rolex this isn't it.  The pictures on the website pretty accurately reflect what it looks like but I threw a few more on the review to help with sizing.  Keep in mind this a large face watch.  Reminds me of the Diesel Brand.

PROS:
- Large, easy to read displays
- Large watch (look at photos comparing to an Altoids tin, quarter and my old Seiko)
- Looks cool
- Heavy duty band

MINUS:
- The band is already showing wear around the buckle and I have never worn it before today
- Programming the digital watch is not the same as other watches (Timex, Casio) expect a learning curve
- Watch crystal is flush with the surface so will likely get scratched

Bottom Line:  For the price it is a nice little watch but it seems more Armitron than Seiko
summary: Pretty cool watch if you grade it considering price

reviewText: I'm kind of annoyed with my recent order. I ordered these socks a while back and they were fantastic, so I wanted more. I clicked to order the exact same thing, marked 'crew sock' and showing a photo of a sock that comes up several inches above the ankle.  What I *received* was a pair of MINI crews, that barely clear my ankle, and which are more lightly padded than the trail hiking crew. This isn't worth the money charged, (a), and isn't how the produce was represented on Amazon.  It feels like a giant pain to package and return a tiny pair of socks, but I'm cheesed off about the cost and the fact that I can't use these for anything other than house socks. One star = bad result.
summary: First pair I ordered = great; second pair I ordered = fail.

It's not nearly as luxurious or thick as the picture, and the hood is soooo much smaller. The garment is one piece of fabric, no lining or anything, cut out and sewn together with the edge finished. The Concord Purple is very pretty.  This jacket is so light-weight and warm; it's hard to believe.  It is TOASTY no matter how frigid it is outside. I live in New Jersey and have worn this in temps in the upper 20's and low 30's.  I usually wear this jacket with just a long sleeve cotton T-shirt or a quick-dry shirt underneath.  I wear this during my 3-4 mile walks, and after a few minutes, I usually end up unzipping it to cool off.  I have even worn it in single digits, with a sweat-shirt underneath and have been very toasty.  The only negative is the sizing.  I fall in-between the small and medium on the Patagonia size chart.  The small was just a bit tight under my arms, so I ended up getting the medium which fits a bit roomy in the body.  Still, the fit is very flattering.  It has a long, lean look, and comes right to my hips, slightly covering the top of my butt.  I am 5 ft 8 inches, 120 pounds, tall and thin. My measurements are 36B-29-36.  I usually wear a size 4 or 6.  Depending on how you want to layer this, it will dictate your size.  I wear mine as the outer layer so I went with the medium to give me more options for wearing a sweater or sweatshirt underneath.  Hope this helps!
summary: Very pretty color, flattering fit, light-weight and SUPER WARM!

reviewText: I'm always hesitant to buy clothes on Amazon that are off-brand as there's no real guarantee on the quality you're gonna get. I forever wanted a black lace kimono in my wardrobe and found a really cute one on Forever21 that was unfortunately sold out in all sizes. I searched Amazon and this is pretty similar to what that kimono looked like, so I purchase it. One of the hems on the sleeves oddly ran past the sleeve and as with most lace I'm scared of putting it in the washer as this really is delicate. As for sizing, purchase your usual size, or a size up. These kimonos are meant to fit loosely and that's exactly how the medium fit for me. I was unsure of how it would fit based on mixed reviews so I did order a size up, but it's not too baggy and I could have definitely ordered a small (I'm not sure if a small was available at that time, though). I had absolutely no issue with the sleeves or anything being too tight as they were actually as baggy as you would expect from the picture. The tag says "ZAPA" and I had to do a double take wondering if I was send a kimono from ZARA, LOL! For the price this is good but don't expect the quality being amazing especially for this price point. Overall, I'm pretty content with my purchase.
summary: Very Cute, but Quality is... eh.

reviewText: My almost 4 year old was super excited to get this, she loves everything Elsa. Not the greatest quality, the crown is 2 part and sometimes detaches. Great! Just what I was looking for. My daughter wanted to be Elsa for Halloween, and this really made the outfit. I read the reviews that said the braid was too heavy for the clip, so I sewed a little rubber band on the back of the blue snowflake, next to the clip, and it works great! The wand and crown are decent for the price. Plastic, but that is to be expected. I had one rhinestone fall out, but I just glued it back on with superglue. Great purchase for the price!

reviewText: Love the hair piece but the wand and tiara are junky. In fact, my niece was heartbroken when I went to put it all on her and the tiara literally broke out of the package. The hair is fine so far and my suggestion for fine hair is to do a low ponytail and try to clip the hair within the ponytail for more hold. Made a HUGE difference in staying on since it's essentially a barrette and those are hard to get to stay on anyway.

Absolutely disappointed! These pants are quite beautiful, I wanted them for a dressy party. However, they were far too short for me.

I ordered size large, and the fit was perfect had they been longer. They were at least 2 inches too short, even with no shoes on, and I had planned to wear at least a 3 inch heel. They were of such high quality that I may have considered keeping them for flats had they been 3 inches longer, I would have needed them to be about 5-6 inches longer if I wanted to wear heels. Sadly, I am returning them.

After reading the other reviews about material being too heavy I thought I would comment on this to be helpful for other potential buyers. The material is of a heavier weight, which lends to the overall look being very classy and expensive looking so I found this to be a plus had they been long enough for me to keep. This made the pants extremely flattering because the material flowed over any flaws and hid them. If they were longer and sold them in 10 colors, I would have bought all 10, they looked that good.

Also, as far as the sizing, I chose the size that corresponded to my numerical size and it was perfect, except for the length. Lixmee,, please increase the length of this product! If they are too long for others of smaller height, they can easily have them tailored. For those of us that are a bit taller and wish to wear heels, we are out of luck. If the cost of material is the issue, I would gladly pay a bit more to have the option of an extended length.

FYI - My guess is that these pants would be perfect for women that are 5'4", or maybe (big maybe)  5'5"  if they plan to wear flats.
summary: Way too short for 5'7" woman, even with flat shoes!

reviewText: These pants are super cute and very well  made. The material is thick and has some weight to it, maintains it's shape well, they seem durable and I expect they will last a very long time.  The pockets are all real and functional which is nice, not just for show as with some cargo's. As for the fit and sizing, I would call them a "slim fit" through the waist and hips, the rise falls about an inch or so below natural waist on me, (I am 5'7") they are not low rise and they come up a little higher in the back than the front. If you are of a certain age :) you may remember the popular cotton pant made by Z Cavaricci back in the 80's/90's, they fit and feel a lot like them. The inseam is 33" for the medium size, length is fine for me.  According to the sizing chart, I would fall between an extra small or small, however, in reading other reviews and being somewhat experienced in ordering pants on-line I did decide to size up, I ordered the medium and they fit perfect.

First of all I love these pants so much that I bought a second pair in green. They are great fitting cargo pants and the small fits me perfectly. I'm 5'9" and normally wear a size 2-4 and a 33" inseam.
That being said.  They do have a few issues. When I washed the green pair (cold water, inside out, delicate cycle, hang to dry) the seam across the back yoke frayed. This is a manufacturing defect, in that the seam wasn't sewn correctly to begin with. But I washed them when they say to dry clean, so I fixed it myself. Also the green pair had one of the front pockets folded over and sewn into the side seam making the pocket unusable so I fixed that also. The green pair is slightly larger than the black pair, making them more comfortable. That's the main reason I didn't return the green pair because of the pocket defect. I wasn't sure how the replacement pair would fit.

First the color-Very deceptive. The coat actually arrived as a Chocolate Brown. I ordered 1 size down & the fit was ok. The coat is actually well made and heavy but the color was a bad omen. I wondered why they showed a honey color when, in fact, it is much darker. The reason is that the dark color doesn't really work as well with this jacket; it looks frumpy---like a $600. welders coat with pockets. I waited a long time to buy this coat & now my disappointment runs deep. Yes. The photo of the coat is enticing but upon delivery all you get is a bait and switch.

This is an AMAZING coat. Sadly, it was tailored far too big so I had to return. I am a 41 chest so, I can fit medium or large depending on a few stitches, I ordered a large because I wanted to have room for sweaters or fleece but this came almost as an extra large. Some things about it, first, it is made in India which makes me suspect the origin of the hide used. The hide is what I would call lambskin. It is ultra soft, but not a rugged coat for outdoors. Secondly, the lining is not quilted nor is the jacket insulated to any noticeable degree. Apart from these two VERY minor criticisms, if the coat had been tailored to size, I'd be wearing it right now. It got 4 stars because of size but, it's ORVIS so there is no question of quality. If you want one, order a size (or two) smaller. It really is worth the money if you are looking for a coat that looks rugged and speaks to the style of Teddy Roosevelt.
summary: Stunning coat but it is HUGE!

reviewText: Love it!

I got this for my wife (who is petite) and she absolutely loves it! She's a major whovian and it accompanies her future companion t-shirt perfectly. I think she would sleep in this if she could. Unfortunately this was a tad to small so I had to exchange it for one size larger. I purchased it using the Junior size chart and it fits my wife like a glove. Some would say perfectly, but given that this is a hoodie and she likes wearing these things a little more loosely I exchanged it for the next size up. She can't wait for the replacement!!!

The first time my friends child wore this the zipper broke. I attempted to return this and was told that was not possible. I would highly recommend not purchasing this product!  It was expensive and poor quality.

This was a very disappointing purchase. For the price, I was expecting something heavier in weight and with functional pockets.  The pockets are sewn into the side seams and so sit farther back than what you would typically find in a garment of this style. They are not easy to get your hands in/out of are basically useless.  They dangle on the interior of the jacket rather than being sewn into the material or even on the front exterior, so forget about keeping any weighted items, such as keys or wallet, in them as they sag and shift, making your torso look like a morphing, tumorous blob.  The fabric feels cheap, extremely lightweight, and the interior is already "pilling" and rubs off on my clothing.  You're paying for the Doctor Who logos, not the garment itself.

This was a nice hoodie, but unfortunately it was just a little too big for me. I chose the small because it was listed as a juniors hoodie, and I typically wear a small in juniors. However the hoodie was very long, and the size was much larger than what I had expected based on the picture and the sizing chart. I would have exchanged it for an extra small but just based on the cut of the hoodie I don't think that would have fit me either. Other than the sizing though I really liked it. If it had fit a little better I definitely would have kept it. I like my hoodies to fit more snug but if you like a baggier hoodie this hoodie is perfect. It was very comfy and looked exactly the way it does in the picture color wise.

Ok bag, given that it is nice looking leather and priced relatively inexpensively. It has a nice looking distressed leather that elicits a lot of positive comments. The zipper on top is not great. Oiled or greased once a month, it works acceptably, but is often difficult to close otherwise. The other hardware is cheap. The carry strap hardware on one side broke after a few uses, on a day when I had the bag packed to about 40 lbs, probably my fault as I shouldn't have packed it this heavy as the hardware tolerance seems less than that. I repaired it with about $14 in stainless steel parts from the hardware store, as shown in the photos. The other side of the strap has not broken, but I keep the bag now about 20 lbs or less. Still usable and a reasonable value for the price, for those who would rather not spend for a more expensive, higher quality bag. Mine did not come with a luggage tag, as some of the on-line stock photos show, but I keep it mostly in the trunk of my car with extra clothes for work or for the gym, so I don't really need one. If that is important for a prospective purchaser, would need to verify inclusion of a luggage tag with the seller prior to ordering.

reviewText:
This is the cutest Star Trek costume I've ever seen! It's based on Star Trek: The Next Generation's science/medical uniforms (think Counselor Troi or Doctor Crusher), but it's a short dress. My mother actually mistook it for a classic Trek uniform, until I told her it was from ST:TNG. It's a "skater dress" (referring to the length and cut of the skirt) and even though they don't mean it literally, I think it would be awesome to see a figure skater wear this on the ice, while skating to one of the themes from the newest Star Trek film! Personally, I bought it to wear to DragonCon, the massive sci-fi/fantasy convention held in Atlanta every summer.

Be aware that the sizing is juniors, so if you're used to wearing women's sizes, don't order your regular size or it will be too small! Go up at least one size, if not two. I typically wear a small or medium in women's, while in juniors I'm usually a large. All the reviews said it was very small, so just to be safe, I ordered an extra-large, which fits comfortably. If I went down a size, it would still fit, but would be rather snug. It's also rather short. One reviewer said it barely covered her rear, but mine isn't quite that short! I was hoping it *would* be, so I could wear it with jeans, like a long t-shirt. It comes to about mid-thigh on me, which might look a bit strange with jeans, but it's too short to wear on its own. (I'm not that brave, even at DragonCon!) However, it should look adorable with black leggings, or black pants, which is my plan.

The communicator and commander's pips are printed on, which means they might eventually start to peel or crack. I assume that's the reason why this dress is air-dry only---you're not supposed to put it in the dryer. If you think it looks too cheesy, you could probably pin real pips and a communicator badge over the printed ones. That's what I wanted to do, but I didn't have time to order them before DragonCon. Maybe next year!

Overall, I'm extremely happy with this purchase. It was a bit on the expensive side when I ordered, but it's so cute! The low neck and cap sleeves give it a modern twist, while making it more bearable to wear in warmer venues, like DragonCon in Atlanta, or ComicCon in Phoenix or San Diego. The fabric is stretchy, which helps accommodate different sizes and shapes. It's absolutely perfect for fans of Star Trek. I'll give it five stars and recommend it for anyone who wants a unique, quirky way to play dress-up for any science-fiction event. Or, it's comfortable enough to wear as a nightgown, if you wanted.

P.S. If blue isn't your color, it also comes in red (command), or gold (security/engineering). Don't forget your tricorder, phaser, and a couple of tribbles!

Before I bought the blue dress, I had bought the yellow and red TNG a-line dresses from ThinkGeek.  Those were both Large and fit me (5'0, 140 pounds) perfectly.  Since ThinkGeek was sold out of the blue, I bought it here.  Even though it is the same label, same code on the tag, and looks exactly the same - the blue is a LOT smaller than the other two.  I'm not sure if ThinkGeek has 'adult' dresses and these are 'junior,' but the tags on the dresses don't differentiate.  Again, they are the same numbers.  The blue is just smaller I guess.

I had purchased cheap readers at the local dollar store but you get what you pay for.  These are light, comfortable and super clear.  They came in wrapped packaging but was delighted to find enclosed a cloth eyeglass case and fabric glass cleaners.  Do not hesitate to buy these glasses but play with your magnification at a local store.

The fit was not authentic and was not comparable to my other TRBJ jeans. The button rivets were smaller than the original jeans and unlike the original the inside fasteners were the same size and not different sizes like the orginial. The fake Super T stitching was poor quality and had threads coming loose and the ultimate area of fake fail was the stitching in the crotch area which was unlike the original Super T's that I have. I left negative feedback for the seller (should be zero stars really) but for some reason the seller was able to get it removed. However there was similar feedback from just before my feedback from another buyer who had the same problem and magically that negative was removed as well.

So Zero Stars for Webzom the seller of Fake True Religion Jeans at full retail price!

In the meantime avoid buying this and other listed jeans to avoid fakes as the seller is clever in getting negative feedback removed.

reviewText: Great shoes!  I buy these for my son who has Type 1 diabetes.  I took him to a well-known running store and had him fitted properly - for these shoes - and bought a pair there.  Then I came home and ordered another pair (substantially cheaper) from Amazon, so he can switch them out every day.  It's much healthier to change your shoes out every day.

These shoes are great for running, working out at the gym or taking a stroll. They feel a bit narrow on my feet so I am not sure if I should have bought a size up from my normal size (9.5). However, the snug fit is still comfortable and does not cut off blood circulation.

These shoes look fantastic and are well designed and manufactured. The is absolutely nothing "cheap" about them.

They are very light on the feet and does not cause any noticeable drag during movement. I'm not sure about the benefits of the "boost" technology as there is no way for me to measure it. What I can say it that of all the athletic shoe brands and models that I have worn, this is one of the best.

It fit fine, however, I'm a little disappointed in the sleeves and feel they're a bit short for my arm.  I'm used to caftan sleeves reaching to just above the elbow.  Contrary to what was said about it needing to be hand washed and not to put in the dryer, I was told by another purchaser that she did wash and dry in the machines.  First, though, I colorfast it, having done that with previous batik  caftans. Then, I washed it in my machine, used a fabric softener in the wash rinse and then dried in my dryer on low and it was wearable straight out of the dryer.
  To naturally colorfast the fabric, in one gallon of fresh, clean, cold water, add 1/4 cup table salt and one cup white vinegar, give the water a swish to make sure the salt and vinegar are evenly distributed.  Add the caftan and press it into the water until it's fully saturated. That's it! Let the fabric soak in the water for 24 hours to ensure the color is completely set. You might notice a bit of color in the water, but that's OK. Remove the item, dump the water and rinse the container, and fill it with fresh water. Add the fabric back to the container and gently squish and swirl it, refreshing it with clean water. If you still see color releasing from the fabric, repeat a soaking in the vinegar saltwater. Let the fabric fully dry, and your item will hold its color the next time it's tossed in the wash. Immediately after I colorfast the garment in that solution, I put it in a cold rinse cycle of my machine with Downy Liquid Fabric Softener and then dried in my dryer for 20-30 mins. then took it straight out of the dryer and hung it up till I was ready to wear it.  As a senior who now lives in South Texas where the summers are unbearably hot, wearing a caftan to the grocery store is much cooler for me.
Had to wash 3 times to remove chemical smell, and it is a little smaller than others of this style I've bought in the past. Not a bad buy for the price, and I may get one more.

Even though they stretch, I suspect that this won't be very comfortable being made out of this material and tight on the arms. As I just received them today, I don't know yet whether they'll stand the test of time, but I suppose I can always edit my review if they don't live up to their expectations. I work at home doing transcription work, and these are absolutely perfect for my fingers to have full mobility on the keyboard while keeping my arms warm. I type constantly - up to 14 hours a day at my keyboard. I used to cut the tips of my toe socks and use them for this reason, but these are much sturdier and way more comfortable. reviewText:
I received the sweater way earlier than expected which was great but it was missing the belt! I contacted the seller and they was very eager to resolve the issue. They are sending me the belt so, I'm pleased with that. Especially since it was resolved in 24hrs.

And mine had no smell what so ever. I wore it the very next day without washing it. The length is what I expected considering they gave measurements in the description. I knew what to expect. The sleeves as well are just as the stated. I'm 5'5, 129lbs with a bust size 36 (bra size 32D) and it's a tad snug in the bust area. The length hits just above the bottom of my butt. The sleeves are right at the wrist but can be stretched a bit. Overall I think it's a really nice sweater. I was going to give it 4 stars because of the lack of a belt but they handled the issue so well that I decided to give it a 5 anyways. If the belt isn't what I expected then I may reconsider that decision.

I like for my coats and sweaters to fit lose. I like to snuggle in mine when I am sitting on the couch in the winter time watching a movie or something. The material was soft and not itchy which was a great factor because nothing sucks worse than itchy right! The hood had a nice piece of plaid fabric sewn into it, gave this item a nice touch. I would recommend this to you if you like snug fitting coats and if you don't I would suggest ordering the next size up.

reviewText: Awesome dress.  My daughter made a last minute decision and needed it for a party.  Amazon Prime worked perfectly.  The quality is great -- even though it is inexpensive, the front design is really pretty, and looks classy.  The lace-up back makes the dress fit, it was still loose at the very top, so double-sided tape ended up being the solution to the small gap.  The cord for lacing is extremely long.  She wears a 34C, so it was laced tightly.  It is on the small size in the waist, she measures two inches smaller than the stated size and it fit -- but was not loose.  The the top is flexible but  the waist has no stretch, so double check both measurements before ordering to the size chart and you will get a great fit.  The dress could benefit from the addition of hooks at the waist and possibly something to help at the top while lacing.  In terms of length, my daughter is 5'2" so it came to above the knee and was a flattering length.

I purchased this dress in large at first, the size according to the dimensions given by the seller, however, it was MUCH larger than the measurements given. I exchanged the product for a medium, which fit perfectly! The back is corseted, so it allows it to be slightly adjustable. The dress arrived much quicker than expected, and it came in a very small package, which made me fearful at first bit the dress expanded upon being taken out of the package.

I ordered it larger so I was expecting to have to take it in at the top. It's going to be perfect for the masquerade ball once I have it altered! Even if you don't have to have it altered, you may wish to have the crinoline fluffed out a little by a dry cleaner due to the flattening of the dress during shipping. I CANNOT wait to wear it!!!

It also helped to keep the laced "v" shape, as without the eye hook the lacing looked more like a rectangle than a "V". Wore it comfortably all night long, dancing, sitting, walking - no problems.

I bought tickets 3 days prior to the second chance prom event for adults and realized I was without a dress. Two days before the event, I looked on Amazon to see if it had anything since a majority of the stores in town were sold out of reasonably priced dresses due to high school proms.

I loved the color of this dress and read the reviews, which stated it was a good purchase. After looking at the size chart, I decided to buy the size 2 dress with one-day shipping. I was not disappointed.

The dress arrived the day before the event. I was actually shocked at how small the packaging was since the dress was rather "fluffy". I took the dress out and not a sequin was out of place. It really was love at first sight.

I'm 5'8 and a 34b in victoria secret. I ended up wearing sandals with the dress because heels are so uncomfortable to dance in. The dress covered them up - slightly meaning I did need to pull up the dress a little while walking downtown as to not get the bottom of the dress dirty, but could let it flow freely while inside the event without worrying about tripping over myself. In all honesty it was a perfect fit. There wasn't a need to wear a strapless bra because the sequin top works perfectly as one. I also did not have to worry about the dress sliding down. It even remained up during the various dances my significant other and I did.

A+ purchase.

Note on images - I was standing lopsided. The dress itself was aligned correctly.
summary: I loved the color of this dress and read the reviews

This might be long but I want to be honest. Okay, so first off I LOVE THIS dress. It comes in the exact color as seen (I got the light teal). In addition, you can send them the measurements to get it fit just right to your body. The dress will fall how it should provided you give them your measurement. The company is SO helpful and willing to work with you. They even offer refund options (I will not be needing to do this). In addition, the shipment was extremely fast. The predicted date of delivery was the 28th of September and I got it on the 11th.

I love the measurement options because I am a Plus Sized Woman and it is so hard to get something to ever fit my body right. With that being said there were a few hiccups so here they are and here are some tips and recommendations to the seller:

1. Dress was to long. I am only 5'6" and the hallow to floor measurement is not accurate. The dress is even to long with 4" heels on. Make sure when sending length measurements that you emphases your height and the hallow measurement. Luckily my mom can sew and is willing to help me hem it.
2. Dresses waist was an 1 1/2" to big for me and will need to be taken in. This was my fault. I measured my waist and ordered it an inch smaller for predicted weight loss. I lost more than I should have.
3. Shipping: please ensure you give them your living address not P.O Box

Overall great looking dress, color is true to what seen, feels great on, fabric beautiful, I feel pretty in it, and SOME OF THE BEST CUSTOMER SERVICE I HAVE EVER RECEIVED.

I typically don't order products that have less than three stars, but I was desperate. Ace bandages just weren't doing it for me anymore, and I really needed a chest binder for cosplay, and this was the cheapest alternative I could find since I couldn't afford an Underworks binder. My friends, if your chest is bigger than 36 inches, don't buy this. I'm a 38D and ordered the biggest size they had (which many said would still fit). I could get the clasps closed, but after only two hours of wear, I was in so much pain I could barely breathe. The next day was even worse. I felt like I had been beaten over the back with a baseball bat and had the bruises to prove it. It did follow through with its purpose, though... It made me flat. That was about the only thing it did for me, though. I ended up having to give it to a friend who had a much smaller chest. It works great for her, and honestly, I ended up making my own binder out of a pair of old women's shapewear underwear. Frankly, the latter is much cheaper and works the same way and /doesn't/ feel like Satan clawing "the girls" to death.

I ordered this top on June 5, 2016. The estimated delivery date was from June 30th to July 21st. It was delivered to my door June 8, 2016 coming all the way from Mumbai (via DHL). You can't get much better than that! The color of the top isn't the orange-yellow "mustard" color described/shown in the picture, it is better......a bright sunny yellow, which I love! I ordered size Medium, which is what I received. It is a little snug in the mid-section, but that is not the manufacturers fault; it is mine due to my ice cream addiction! (I am on a diet having lost 10 Lbs so far & expect to lose 5 to 10 more) I bought the top to wear to my daughter's combination college graduation & 50th birthday party in July this year, so it should fit perfectly by then. I plan on wearing it with black leggings, but would go well with leggings of other colors as well. It is a thin, knit, 97% viscous / 3% lycra, T-shirt like material, and is very soft, but also has a front lining in the bust area which is a plus. It appears to be well made. Cleaning instructions state first time dry clean, then hand wash separately in cold water, and dry flat, but I see no reason for that if machine washed in cold water on the gentle cycle with like colors and materials using a gentle detergent, and dried on air dry cycle of dryer and promptly removed. The manufacturer also enclosed a necklace as a free gift for ordering from them!
I would highly recommend this product to every woman, and I plan on purchasing from them again.

The case just isn't big enough, in all the dimensions, to properly hold more than 10 cards (5 on either side) comfortably.  If you've ever handed out business cards, you know you need to carry more than just ten. Taking cards out and putting them in can also be more work than it's worth.  The materials used are too soft, as the hinge and spring simply don't hold up.  The release button also became easily detached after the case was dropped once from a height of four feet.

In other words, keep looking at other card holders and pass this one up.

I love the look of this case and used it as a wallet.  I bought a similar one about a year ago that broke, and so I bought this one to replace it. reviewText: I love my Seahawk shoes and have gotten many compliments on them.
Much much smaller than expected. Very cheap looking. I'll  never wear  or  order  from that  company again.

They ship straight from China, using the China Post, that's why it takes so long to get them.  I'm not sure what the point to the zipper is.  Silly me thought it would harbor a secret compartment.  I'm a predictable size and the lack of ability to try them on beforehand does not bother me but these are a little tight and I am concerned they'll get pretty darn uncomfortable come end of day on game day.  Oh, did I mention the shoelaces aren't the same size and are much too long?  The one on the left is a boot shoelace and a little longer than the other.  I'll have to replace those.  And I kind of wonder if they have permission to use the image.  The logo could be clearer, sharper, and more vibrant in color.  It's kind of dull.  But that's why it was $20 cheaper than anything else I could find.
summary: You get what you pay for

reviewText: Adorable. Goes with any situation

At 5ft 9", and with hips & a butt (i.e. curvy) I can pretty much get away with any maxi-skirt but I read the reviews and was nervous about this one. The reviews seem all over the spectrum but the price seemed worth the risk. It arrived promptly and I tried to ignore the packaging which made it look like I'd just ordered a parachute. I sliped the dress on and felt circus-like (NOT GOOD). It "fits" but...OH MY. The elastic waist is sewn tightly meaning that if you have the slightest curves from your waist down, the fabric looks more like clown pants. If you have a very small butt and narrow hips you'd probably get away with this (If you *actually* look good in skinny jeans, this skirt is for you). Sadly that wasn't the only issue. It is MEGA long. Not just a few inches...MEGA. While wearing it, the skirt was like a puddle on the floor around me (I'm 5ft 9" so this is very unusual). I took the skirt off, held the hem of the skirt to just below my ankles and then saw how high the waistline was. It was awkwardly at the part of my chest where you measure your bra cup size. Yeah. Dissappointed. I could tailor it to fit but then I'm doing the work to make it from a 2-star skirt to a 5-star skirt.
Right now this skirt just feels like a tribute to a Circus: Big-top style fabric, clown-pants like hem, and have to walk on stilts to wear it as a skirt!!
summary: Elastic waist is sewn too tight and skirt is WAY too long

reviewText:
I have being wearing Ray-ban sunglasses for over three decades, and with the ones I have been wearing for the past five odd years becoming rather scuffed up through constant every-day usage, it was time to procure a new pair. After looking through the huge range available from Ray-ban I came across this pair that appealed to me. They are meticulously crafted, and rather light weight beauties; which should provide great protection for my light sensitive eyes for many years to come. To me it is always a good sign for a pair of sunglasses; that after slipping them on; you do not realise that you are wearing them. The polarized grey lens do a fantastic job, with ones vision not distorted at all. If you are looking for good, stylish protection for your eyes then I would suggest you try these sunnies out.

Cheers,

Peter.

reviewText:
Per the review earlier in November, I ordered the size based on US sizes and received an XL (per the tag).  I'm usually somewhere between a small-medium in US sizes (5' 4", 130 lbs), so I expected it to fit alright.  Well, it is so small I can barely button it.  Even if I was slightly less busty (and I'm a B cup), the arms were at least 2 inches too short.  I'm not even going to attempt to return this as there was no return address and I have no idea how much it would cost to ship it back overseas.

This coat has no pockets.  The material is felt - not the thinnest felt, but not particularly thick either.  It does feel nice and soft, but there is no way this would keep you very warm in any weather cooler than say 45 degrees Fahrenheit.  The cut is cute, but I also know it wouldn't do the nice scrunch at the top even if it did fit me.  For the price, it's exactly what I would expect, not a coat that will last forever, but it would have been cute for a while (except the lack of any pocket thing, that's a disappointment).
Very thin, not even a coat it was a jacket. Im returning it

Very cute. The buttons all work, and the belt is the perfect length. I am normally a US 2/small, but usually order a 4/medium due to my broad shoulders.

The jacket is made of a very soft material. I did not experience a smell like some have stated. It is lined on the inside and though it is not a heavy coat for extreme cold, it definitely would be able to keep you warm on a crisp autumn day or a winter evening that's not too cold. Sleeves are not super long as I usually like, more like average or slightly shorter than normal. I'm just under 5'5" and it's about four inches above my knee when standing up straight.
summary: Very nice lightweight jacket for the fall.

This concept was so cute, I just had to have them.  Who doesn't love mermaid leggings?

However, these are WAY too small, I'm not even going to attempt to try and fit into them. I am 5'4" and weigh around 125, and usually wear a 4 or a 6 in pants.  These are definitely meant for someone much skinner, and taller! I placed them next to my workout leggings (old navy size medium) for reference. You can see the difference in size is pretty noticeable.

My other big issue with them, and this is 100% my OCD kicking in, is the fact the scale face the wrong way.  They are going up instead of down.  In every other picture and review they are going the right way, I seem to have gotten the "lucky" pair that is facing the wrong direction.  Ugh.

In a positive note, the color is really pretty, and they are very shiny and sparkly like a mermaid, so props for trying, this product is just not for me.  I received this item at a discount on exchange for an honest review, all opinions are my own.  I will however be passing these along to my friend who will hopefully be small enough to fit in them, and hopefully won't be driven made by the scales being upside down.

I don't know if I'm more disappointed in the time it took to ship to me, the poorly thought out sizes, or the shoddy craftsmanship here. Let's go in order. I ordered this for halloween. It got here closer to Christmas. The sizing is ridiculous. If you've ever seen an extra small girl and a medium girl next to each other, you know they can't wear the same dress. I am not a big person by any means, a little busty perhaps, but not a large person. I look like a tube of sausage in this dress. The fabric isn't anywhere near stretchy enough, and it's very sheer in between the scales. It's your basic halloween costume material that traps heat and sweat and isn't very comfortable. A terrible fabric for a form fitting dress. But I think the worst thing about this dress, hands down, is the way it was sloppily sewn together. There are holes along every seam of this thing, like the machine would just skip a few stitches. The edges aren't hemmed, and there are long threads hanging down in places. Obviously others have had a better experience than me, so buy at your own discretion.
I received this dress at a discount in exchange for my honest review.
summary: I don't know if I'm more disappointed in the time it took to ship to me

reviewText: I haven't a clue how a man of average endowment is supposed to fit into these ridiculously small pouches and heaven help someone like me who is larger than average.  I couldn't get one ball into the pouch much less my entire package.  Don't waste your money on these way-too-small pieces of junk.

First, I need to admit I didn't order these items. I did but I cancelled the order and the company sent them anyway. After trying them on though I doubt that they would like me to send them back.

For reference I ordered the XL size and I have a 31 in waist and I weigh 150 lbs.

The waist size was fine, actually a little large which was a nice addition. The pouch as well was just about the right size. I ordered two sizes up from normal and I got it right for once.

My big complaint is the elastic strap. First, I had a very difficult time figuring how it was supposed to fit. This is my first time with underwear like this and a how to diagram would have been helpful .

But the strap/ loop was also was too small. It barely fit even when stretched to the max and when on was cutting off my circulation. Not a great feeling in underwear.

If they would have a slightly lager loop or possibly one that could be tightened as needed (like a string) then this product might have a chance. Otherwise, it was just too uncomfortable for any extended use.

In short, I would not recommend this product.
summary: you get what you pay for

reviewText: I absolutely love this shawl! It's a beautiful color (much more beautiful in person!), and it's a nice size. I've used this scarf around my neck and around my head, and it's pretty both ways! It's soft and I get so many compliments on it. Love it!

If you are not aware (I wasn't) this scarf is 100% Modal. Modal is a variation of Rayon and is a very lightweight fabric.

If you look closely at the picture, you will notice that the ends of the scarf (unlike the sides) are not finished, rather are left in a lightweight shag style that gives this leopard print a bit of a wilder look.

The pattern is one-sided, the back does not have the same intensity as the front. I have been wearing this scarf with both black and brown and find that it works well with either color.

I received a free scarf to test for my review and am happy to report that I would recommend it to my friends, and find the price comparable to many of the dress shops I have frequented.

That being said, it's also fairly thin towards the back.

I'm going to be using it in cosplay with a hat, so I'm not worried about any of this, but for someone who is going to wear it as is or try and style it in some way, you may want to look into a thicker wig, or purchasing extra wefts to sew into it.

Great wig, looks really good and very natural. I had several people asked me if it was my real hair (it was dark and inside the night club). I used it as a part of my Halloween costume (I wanted to be Jem from Jem and the Holograms). My only tiny complaint would be that I wish it were a little longer.

We bought this item for a Pearl (from Steven Universe) Halloween costume. Using Elmers Glue and hairspray, we were able to make this thing defy gravity without a single complaint from it. It stayed smooth and the strands are very sturdy-- it outlasted a seven year old repeatedly tugging on and removing it throughout the night. And such an awesome price for the quality! I highly recommend this wig.

reviewText: Its small than expected

So I read all the reviews and ordered a size up. I normally wear a large in men's, so I ordered a US XL in this denim jacket (the Asian equivalent of a 4XL) . I love this jacket and the length of the sleeves are perfect, but I will say that it's still a little tighter than what I was expecting so I will have to keep it unbuttoned all the time. I would say this definitely runs 2 sizes too small, so keep that in mind. The hood detaches with little black buttons which kind of stick out on the light gray fabric. White buttons would have looked much better, but no biggie. Overall, this is a great denim jacket for a great price -- but I would say order 2 US sizes up from the one you actually wear if you want to layer this over something and still be able to button it closed comfortably.

reviewText: I ordered this for my husband according to his measurements. We ordered an XL and unfortunately it's just a little bit too snug. He can wear it open but it's a little uncomfortable when it's buttoned up. He's very broaden the shoulders and chest so it may just be his body shape. For an average or more narrow-bodied man it should be fine. The denim is thick but I think the sleeves and hood could be a little thicker for warmth. It's well-made and it looks really nice and fashionable when it's worn. Very happy with it! I received this product at a discount in exchange for my honest review.

My fiance was looking for a new jacket that was comfy looking, so we chose this one. My fiance had a few things (some good, and quite a few things needing work) to say in regards to trying this jacket out. ((He likes the simplicity of pros and cons list so that is why the review is in that format)). These are the things he told me he had to say about this:

Pros:
-style is retro but cool
-He was told Denim is starting to come back in style
-removable hood is awesome!
-Length on his torso is just right, (not to long and not too short)
-Color of dark denim looks good on my fiance (he's so handsome)

Cons:
- a bit tight for the sizing (we chose a much bigger size based off the reviews of others prior to us)..
-sleeves too short by about 2"
-shape is a bit boxy and thus unflattering (in the torso area)
-no pockets on the sides for hands
-button size too big for holes (make the holes a bit bigger so next time closing and taking off coat won't be so difficult)

All and all, my fiance likes the coat but it needs some serious work to make it really worth the cost, and make it more comfortable to wear. These are all suggestions and our hope is the company will use them to better their product. Not sure if we'd recommend them to friends and family based off the issues we had with it, but he'll wear it. I just don't feel it's worth the money at this point. If they make vast improvements, that may change.

We received this Free in exchange for our honest review based off our experience with it/them, good or bad. All opinions expressed here are mine or my fiance's.

The hoodie is a drawstring which is nice, it fits my husband very well and I could even wear it if I wanted/needed to it wouldn't look awful on a girl it's just a little big on me but it's not bad! So I like that it has several options to it! I purchased this jacket for my son and he loves it. We purchased him another jacket to go with this one and the ones he had from last year and this one is the only one we can get him to wear since ordering it. When ordering I was a bit confused about the sizing from other peoples reviews but I decided to just follow the instructions provided by the seller and I'm glad I did. When it arrived it fit perfectly. The sizing from the US to China are a bit different but again if you follow the sellers instructions you should be just fine. I was worried about the sleeves being a little thin (we live in the south and it gets a little cold here) but they are very warm. The vest part is jean, again not thin at all, the weight of the jacket is what I call in between. It's not so heavy that it's a coat but not so thin that it won't keep you warm in the fall (again, i'm in the south). I have had to wash it a few times since receiving it and it has not shrunk and that's with just washing it and throwing it into the dryer. The only downside to this jacket is the fact that it does not have pockets which my son doesn't mind at all. I myself and my son highly recommend this jacket. I was given this product at a discounted rate for my honest unbiased opinion.
summary: When ordering I was a bit confused about the sizing from other peoples reviews but I decided to just follow the instructions pro

Material is soft. Some sweaters are scratchy, this is not. The dress doesn't itch my skin and is comfy on. I can tell it's a very high end material and made to really get wear from it for a long time. It will keep warm in the winter but not to make you sweet. This dress has a good stretch to it. I don't have a pencil figure, I'm a curved woman and I do like this style on me, even with the irregular cut bottom. The collar bone has a nice round shape. The arms go a little past my wrist and isn't tight at all. I ordered extra large and it is true to size. The dress is classy and would be great to wear to church, weddings and even daily wear. I do recommend.
I received this product free to provide my honest and unbiased review. My opinions are me 100%.

reviewText: It's an amazing ring, I like it
Ok... it was a bit big..

I had been wanting this ring for a long time and finally had the opportunity to purchase it "used, like new" through Warehouse Deals at a discounted price. When I received it, it was perfect and only the original box had been substituted, so I was quite pleased.

I tried it on and it fit well. No problems there.  I noticed that it seemed uncomfortable, however, and rubbed between my fingers due to the Cubic Zirconias being set all around the band.  As I wore it around the house, I found that they didn't sparkle like I had expected either.  They are pretty little stones and appear to be set very well, but I just didn't see them catch the light and sparkle like I'd expected they would.  I ended up deciding to return it, mostly due to the discomfort, but also due to the fact that it didn't impress me enough to put up with it.

I have a number of Myia Passiello jewelry pieces and have always been happy with their quality and design.  This ring looked sturdy and was made well too.  Perhaps the different colored rings in this design are more impressive but this "clear on silver" just didn't bring the bling that the price would mandate for me, and I only paid about a third of the retail price.

Edit- 7-17- I have taken a chance and purchased this ring in other colors since writing this review and added a star. I have the black, blue, and the turquoise rings and like them a lot. They are much more attractive, colorful, and sparkly than the clear ring, to me, and I've been able to wear them without a lot of discomfort. Of course, this style ring will tend to catch on things a little more than a smooth ring, but not terribly. I suggest you give them a try if you're attracted to the look and style. Myia Passiello has been a reliable, well-made brand for me and I've purchased a lot of pieces. The Swarovski zirconias have always been clear and beautiful, as these are. None of the rings have lost stones yet either! Yay!

The price fluctuates a LOT on these rings so keep tabs to get the best, if you have time. I'd actually give these four and a half stars now.

6-17-18-- Just wanted to add that I've never lost a stone in Myia Passiello jewelry, and I have quite a lot of pieces, including earrings, necklaces, and rings. They are made well and keep their looks with a bit of common sense and care. I'm comfortable recommending them.
summary: Painful and Somewhat Disappointing - Plus Edit - Important to get correct size!

This hoodie/scarf/mitten thingie (not sure what else you'd call this) is really warm and soft. I ordered it with prime shipping and received it on time (2 days). The hood is very large so it does look a little cone-head like, but I like how versatile the large hood makes it. You could pull it around your face for more warmth, or just pull it to the top of your head for a cute (less-conehead-like) look. As another reviewer mentioned, one side of the scarf is longer than the other. It's meant to wrap around your neck (like a scarf) and then both sides are about the same. So if you didn't want to wear this as a scarf, you might look into another option as having one really long side would look weird and wouldn't function as a mitten (unless you had one really long arm). Overall happy with this purchase and can't wait to wear it in some cold weather!

I should've expected it, but I was surprised when I received my hood-scarf-hand-warmer in the mail.  The hood is not centered on the strip that goes around as a scarf.  From the edge of the hood, one "arm" is 20 inches long, while the other "arm" is about 4 1/2 feet long.  Therefore, the scarf looks very odd unless you have it wrapped around your neck.

Once wrapped, the hand-warmers are pretty "short" on me; I'm 5'8", and they hit mid-boob.  As far as walking normally with my hands in the warmers, it's a no-go.  As far as putting my hands in the warmers while I've got my elbows bent/held close to my sides, works great.

The material is super fleecy.  It shed quite a bit coming out of the package, and like many fleece items, it also picks up a lot of lint.  Also like the best fleece materials, this is super soft and super warm. Feels good to the touch.

Overall,  I'm super pleased with this purchase, especially at the price sold.  I think I've made a good investment.  While not using the handwarmers, and with the scarf wrapped around your neck, the garment looks great/feminine.  It's awesome to have the handwarmers built in, so I won't lose them as easily as I do my gloves.

I would recommend the purchase.  Just be aware that it's asymmetrical and won't "look right" unless the scarf is wrapped.

These wool mittens are very well made - the boiled wool is dense to keep the cool air out and the cuffs are soft and not scratchy. And there's no fuzz for baby to ingest if he sucks on his mittens.  Reasonably priced considering they're wool and quality construction. Would buy again for next winter.

reviewText: I've owned this wallet for an estimated 6 years. At the time it was a splurge for me. I am so glad I took the plunge and bought it. This is the longest I have owned a wallet. It looked brand new for years without marks or scuffs even though I used it daily and didn't go easy on it in my usually crowded purse. At the present there is a dark spot over the clasp where my thumb pushes and the sewing next to the zipper on the outer coin purse has ripped about a centimeter. I am just starting to shop around for a new wallet but haven't found any I like as much as this one so I will probably purchase another. I didn't use it for a checkbook, but I filled it up with lots of cards, ids, insurance cards for my kids, loyalty cards, etc.. The cards that were horizontally too long, I had to put in the vertical storage behind the driver's license windowed pocket. I put my more narrow cards in the horizontal section that stores 6 cards. The horizontal card section is pretty tight (no, that section doesn't stretch as other reviewers hoped) but the vertical section can fit longer cards and doubled up cards, and the extra storage for checkbooks can hold cards if needed.
Love this wallet! Perfect for cards and quick Id access

reviewText:
I read in other reviews to order a size up because the cut is for people who are in shape already. I personally am in progress of that route, that's why I wanted to order new sweat pants! That said, while I normally run XL in most things pants related or in boxer briefs, I ordered a 2 XL and they fit great. They are a smidge long on me, but I'm short so that isn't a reflection on them! I always have to get things hemmed up.

They did great in the washer and dryer, though care instructions state to turn them inside out to make the graphics/print last longer. Wash on cold so I do. But I didn't air-dry so they could shrink just a tiny bit.

I also ordered a pair of Blue Sweatpants from them but they sold out of the 2XL right after I ordered it. They contacted me right away and were very personable in their e-mail versus it being automated. They refunded me right away and of course offered an exchange to a different color if I wanted it. I chose to do a refund so I could wait for that color to restock. They said it would take two weeks so I will try again.

I am very happy with their product and service and ordered quite a bit more clothing from Monsta Clothing Co. High quality, comfortable, and clever graphics. Will buy from again!
summary: High Quality, Comfortable, Clever Graphics. Great Service!

reviewText: Ive had my Billetvault for well over a year and it has held up great. I did have an O-ring break and emailed Billetvault and they responded quickly not only with a part number but offered to send a replacement set at no charge. I had mine customized with my logo for a few extra bucks and still received it in just a few days. I would not hesitate to buy another if I were to lose my current one.
Love this wallet.

Love it. I've had mine for 6-9 months now. At first it was difficult to use but now it's really easy. I have 12 cards packed in it. I've broke the o-ring a few times but they are easily replaced. If you have a lot of cards you can use bigger o-rings. I purchased this because I like to keep my wallet in my side pocket of my carpenter jeans. I can't speak much about the cash clip cause I don't use it very often but I did bend it once by packing to much cash in it. I was able to bend it back though.

Really tight when new. Once it breaks in, you never have to worry about cards falling out again. Easy to use, organize and fit in a front pocket. No worries about getting wet with your wallet in your pocket. You won't have to worry about damaging a wallet unless you get run over! I ordered the raw aluminum because it does not show scratches. Many compliments any time I take my wallet out.

You won't find this wallet on a "best minimalist wallets" list, but by God...it is the best minimalist wallet.

After ordering the Radix One, I felt disappointed in the plastic material and silicon band that the wallet was made out of. I wanted something that would be able to hold a minimum of 1-2 cards, while offering a better cash carrying solution than Radix's band. I sent the wallet back immediately. I continued my extensive search for a quality minimalist wallet, and stumbled upon Billetvault.

This wallet is fantastic. The heft and sturdiness of the aluminum really speaks to the quality of this wallet. Using typical O-ring rubber bands to keep both pieces of aluminum together was genius, as they are readily available almost anywhere should they break. The cash clip also allows for the storage of a card if you only want to carry 1 card (for whatever reason).

I've owned mine for about 2 months and it shows no signs of deterioration.
summary: it is the best minimalist wallet

reviewText: very awesome wallet, would buy again. everyone asks me where I got it

Regardless, he loves it and it works way better than the other aluminum wallets that break all the time.
Fantastic! No more bulky wallet that deteriorates over time. Carries everything I need in a compact size AND offers RFID protection. Great for use in front pockets as well.

reviewText: The wallet was what I was looking for as far as sizing, but I did not like the fabric. The shipping was no paid for to send the item back and I also paid almost five dollars just to get the item in the first place, so it would have been cheaper to just keep it.

For the price, I really wish the material and quality was a lot better. I have many hooded sweatshirts, (hoodies). Overall, I'd say this item is of average quality. It's certainly a mediumweight material and rather warm.

  When I unpackaged this sweater, it was very clear that I needed to take a lint roller to it. There was a lot of lint. I was surprised at how much there was. Removing the lint really improved the look.  Unfortunately, there isn't any stretch or give to this fabric... it's pretty stiff material.

Looking at the stitching on the seams. I easily found two spots on one arm where the stitching was not properly secured to the seam. After only three wearings, one of the two spots came undone. I now have a hole that two fingers can pass through, a couple inches up from the wrist cuff, on the forearm seam. Yes it's something I can easily fix. For what I paid, I shouldn't need to though.  I'm pretty dissatisfied!

  If you are a physically fit guy, that is well built, this sweater will likely be too tight along the biceps.  Possibly the forearms too.

Overall, I think this was a so-so purchase. The hoodie looks great but I'm a little disappointed in the fit and very disappointed with the quality and/or the quality control.

reviewText: I was very impressed by the quality in the material of this item - it is so soft and comfortable!  It's also very cute as it appears in the pictures online, though for the red colored hoodie, the hood pattern on the inside is actually a leopard pattern not a dalmatian pattern (not that this bothered me or anything). It fits me perfectly, with the exception of it being about a 1/2 inch short on the sleeves (just an 1/2 inch short of reaching my wrists). Being a smaller individual (5.3 height and 100 pounds)  I've always have a problem with finding clothes that fit me right, so I was very pleased that this item did indeed fit me well despite other reviewers claims of this item running small, I think given the description of the item's measurements was very accurate of how it was going to fit. My advice, be sure to review your own measurements in comparison to the item's measurements to ensure it fits you the way you want it to.

Iron Fist is my favorite shoe brand.  I own almost a dozen pairs of their shoes, and am not stopping there.  Heels, flats, and whatever they come out with, I am sure I will buy.  I give five stars, but I warn everyone I know about this "flaw" regarding Iron Fist - their shoes run small, so be prepared to order a full size up.  Now that I know this, I always do, and have never had a problem since that first pair.  They also have a strong odor the first time you open that shoe box, but after the first time wearing them, I never smell it again, and it frankly isn't strong enough to be annoying.  This pair was a Valentine's gift, and they're so adorable.  I half the time don't want to wear them, because they are so cute.  Maybe I have a shoe collector problem...  Anyway, definitely invest in a pair of Iron Fist shoes.  The craftsmanship and uniqueness is bar none with this company!
